intro: Hedysarum daraut-kurganicum, commonly known as the Daraut-Kurgan heddysarum, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and can remain viable in the soil for extended periods. Hedysarum daraut-kurganicum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides forage for grazing animals in its native range.
